intro: Cephalomappa beccariana, commonly known as the Beccarian's head plant, is a unique member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical, leathery leaves. Native to Southeast Asia, this plant thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, and it produces small, round berries that are edible. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens.
